intro: Sibara tehuelches, commonly known as the Tehuelche sibara, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh, dry conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Sibara tehuelches is an important component of the local flora, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
